message.content: {"id": "17993", "title": "Bug 17993: Find/Replace replaces typed entry with value from history", "description": "The Find/Replace dialog in the F1 build has a history of recent searches. Currently, when typing in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields, if a previous entry from the history matches what is being typed, it replaces the typed entry with the value from the history. This behavior makes it impossible to perform find or replace operations in some scenarios. It would be better if the typed entry is not automatically replaced with a value from the history.", "OB": "The behavior of the Find/Replace feature in the F1 build is causing issues. When typing in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields, if a previous entry from the history matches what is being typed, it automatically replaces the typed entry with the value from the history. This behavior is undesired as it prevents the ability to perform find or replace operations correctly. The existing behavior feels similar to autocomplete functionality commonly found in browsers. However, in the future, it would be beneficial to implement a full autocomplete feature. Instead of replacing the typed entry, suggestions from the history should be presented for selection.", "EB": "When typing in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields, the Find/Replace feature should not automatically replace the typed entry with a value from the history. Instead, it should present suggestions from the history for selection. This way, users can perform find or replace operations accurately without losing their typed entries.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Open the Find/Replace dialog by choosing Edit->Find/Replace... 2. Type 'a' into the Find field. 3. Click 'Find'. 4. Try to type 'A' into the Find field. Observe that the typed entry get replaced with the value from the history, preventing the desired find or replace operation. To fix the issue: Modify the Find/Replace feature to display suggestions from the history without automatically replacing the typed entry."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '17993', 'title': "Bug 17993Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history", 'description': 'It wouldbe better if what I type isn\'t replaced with a value from the history.The current behaviour seems to be similar to "autocomplete" which isparticularly common in browsers. In the future, perhaps, a full "autocomplete"feature could be provided. ', 'OB': 'I\'m using the F1 build.The Find/Replace dialog (accessed through EditFind/Replace...) has a historyof recent searches. When you type in the "Find" or "Replace With" fields itsearches for entries from a previous search. If it finds one, it replaces whatyou have typed with the value from the history. The search of the history iscase insensitive, which means that the case of what you have typed may bechanged to the case of the value in the history.In some scenarios this makes it impossible to perform find or replaceoperations. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'When you type in the "Find" or "Replace With" fields itsearches for entries from a previous search. For example, searching for "hello" and replacing it with "hi" thensearching for "Hello" and replacing it with "Hi" is not possible. Choose EditFind/Replace... Type "a" into the Find field. Click "Find". Try to type "A" into the Find field. '}
